text: Manipulation often relies on urgency, fear, or threats to pressure victims.
Impersonation scams involve pretending to be HR, IT, managers, or authorities.
Trust-building fraud occurs when attackers gain rapport before asking for sensitive data.
Distraction and obfuscation hide malicious content inside long irrelevant messages.
Social engineering uses psychological tactics to manipulate users into risky actions.
Phishing attacks frequently combine manipulation and impersonation for stronger effect.
